page.html:
• Maintaining design systems with proper user research
    Article in Elisa’s Medium Publication about the design thinking methods to help when choosing the next steps for the design system development and growth.
  • Building design systems that leverage your designers, developers and products
    Longer talk on how we pushed Elisa’s design system forward with design thinking, user centered methods and creative ways of presenting boring documentation. This talk was given in London on 17th October 2018 at WEBdeLDN meetup.
  • Building design systems that leverage your designers, developers and products
    Brief talk about applying design thinking approaches when managing and pushing forward design system in Finnish telecommunication company Elisa.
  • Component development with CSS in 2018
    Slightly updated annual lecture given in University of Turku. Video is available.
  • Hands-on with Design Systems
    Full-day workshop about building design system and pattern library (React) in multidisciplinary team.
  • Component development in CSS in 2017
    Lecture for Computer Science students of Aalto University on overall picture of developing interface components using modern CSS component approaches.
  • Pattern libraries through trial and error
    The talk given at DotCSS 2016 (Paris, France) summarize my 8-year-long experience in building pattern libraries. Video and slides are available.
  • Component development in CSS in 2016
    Lecture for Computer Science students of Aalto University on overall picture of developing interface components using CSS.
  • Doing nothing for visual regression testing
    Shaped talk about applying visual regression testing approach to the projects using styleguide-driven development and a show-case how it is very helpful for preventing unwanted interface changes and keeping websites making sense for users. Given in Bologna, Italy. Video and slides
  • To BEM or not to BEM
    Interview to Cristiano Rastelli about using BEM in developing frontend.
  • ReactJS Hackathon @ SC5
    Materials for making a hackathon on React for a beginner level.
  • Doing nothing for visual regression testing
    Visual regression testing approach wrapped into a nice and neat plugin for SC5 StyleGuide presented at HelsinkiJs meetup in October 2015.

  • Driving Style-Guide-Driven Development
    This talk describes experience of brining Style-Guide-Driven Development into practise and reveals how it ended up with developing a special tool — Style Guide Generator by SC5. The presenttaion was given at EmpireJS 2015, New York and ScotlandJS 2015, Edinburgh.

    • Video from EmpireJS, New York
    • Video from ScotlandJs, Edinburgh
    • Slides
  • Automating Style-Guide-Driven Development
    This article at SmashingMagazine was published on 5th March 2105. It explained the motivation and benefits of style-guide-driven development and component-based approach in frontend.
  • Styleguide generator by SC5
    With this presentation I introduced SC5 StyleGuide to frontend developers at Veikkaus and Elisa in December 2014 and January 2015 and Frontend.fi on January 2015.
  • BEM FAQ
    A list of frequently asked questions about BEM and detailed answers to them.
  • JSCS in use at SC5 Online
    This talk given 18th on November at HelsinkiJS meetup presents JSCS, a tool for checking JavaScript code style, and describes experience of useing it in SC5 Online.
  • Tutorial on JavaScript components with i-bem.js
    This set of well-explained examples demonstrates how to create JavaScript components using the basic features of i-bem.js.
  • The thinking behind BEM
    The talk at Front-Trends 2013 gives a birds-eye view of the sometimes surprising ideas behind BEM, and the benefits they offer developers.
  • Maintainable Frontend Development with BEM
    This is a talk given at Metarefresh on 23 February 2013 in Bangalore (India). It shows how BEM helps to keep web interfaces easy-to-maintain and fast-to-develop.
  • Quick start with full BEM stack
    This tutorial shows how to run a BEM-project and enjoy helpful bem tools, efficient BEMHTML templates and declarative JavaScript i-bem.js.
  • What you can borrow from Yandex frontend dev
    The talk about BEM at WebConf Riga on 10 November 2012. Here it’s explained at length what is BEM in terms of CSS. BEM-styled JavaScript is also mentioned as well as some nice tools for frontend development.
    This content is also available as an article “What you can borrow from Yandex frontend dev”.
  • Frontend evolution at Yandex
    Full 7-year evolution of BEM in 10 minutes. This is in the talk at Fronteers Jam Session, October 2012 in Amsterdam.
  • A New Frontend Methodology: BEM
    The first article about BEM in English.
  • How to use BEM! outside Yandex
    Sceencast based on my talk at Yandex.Saturday Conferece on 25 February 2012 in Chelyabinsk (Russia). Says that every team can enjoy BEM and improve its work. Inside you can find examples of using BEM with Haml and Django.
